Lack enough support: The claim lacks evidence or support from any public comments or interviews made by Betsy DeVos.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that there is no evidence of Betsy DeVos ever making the statement about the likelihood of children dying from COVID-19 when schools reopen.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Betsy DeVos made a specific statement about the percentage of children likely to die when they go back to school during the pandemic, which is not supported by any evidence.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the impact of reopening schools by attributing a specific percentage of children likely to die to Betsy DeVos, even though there is no evidence of her making such a statement.
